title: Members
text:
Membership
The TC will be open to members from both academia and industry who have a strong interest in machine vision for industrial inspection. Membership will be drawn from a diverse range of disciplines, including computer vision, artificial intelligence, robotics, automation, and industrial engineering. The TC will also actively encourage participation from early-career researchers, including graduate students, and practitioners to ensure the future growth and sustainability of the field.
Currently, we have the following members. If you are interested in joining the TC, please contact us.

title: Events
text:
The TC will undertake a variety of activities to achieve its objectives:

Workshops and Conferences
Collaborative Research Projects
Publication of White Papers and Guidelines
Networking and Collaboration
Standardization Efforts

title: About TC-8
text:
Governance
The TC will be governed by an elected Chair and Vice-Chair, supported by an Executive Committee comprising experts from key areas within the field. The Executive Committee will be responsible for setting the strategic direction of the TC, organizing activities, and ensuring that the TC’s objectives are met. Regular meetings will be held to review progress, plan future activities, and address any challenges that arise.


Scope
The scope of the TC encompasses the following areas:

Advanced Machine Vision Algorithms: Promotion of cutting-edge algorithms for defect detection, object recognition, and classification in industrial environments.
Sensor Technology and Data Acquisition: Exploration of novel sensors, including high-resolution cameras,hyperspectral imaging, and 3D vision systems, as well as techniques for efficient data acquisition and processing.
Deep Learning and AI Integration: Application of deep learning and artificial intelligence in machine vision to enhance the accuracy, speed, and reliability of industrial inspection systems.
Real-Time Processing and Automation: Research into real-time image processing techniques and their integration with automated inspection systems on production lines.
Standardization and Benchmarking: Development of standards, protocols, and benchmarking tools to ensure consistency and reliability in machine vision-based inspection across different industries.
Applications in Various Industries: Exploration of machine vision applications in sectors such as manufacturing, automotive, electronics, food processing, agriculture, pharmaceuticals, and more.

title: IAPR TC-8: Machine Vision for Industrial Inspection
text:
Objective of TC-8
The primary objective of this Technical Committee (TC) is to promote and coordinate research, development, and dissemination of knowledge in the field of machine vision for industrial inspection. The TC aims to bridge the gap between academia and industry by fostering collaboration among researchers, engineers, and practitioners. It will also seek to establish standards and best practices that can guide the application of machine vision technologies in various industrial sectors.




TC-8: Machine Vision for Industrial Inspection
